public class EventDetailActivity extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity implements EditEventDialogFragment.EditEventDialogListener
The EventDetailActivity class provides a detailed view of a selected event. It allows users to view event details, manage QR codes, send notifications, and perform actions like editing the event, viewing entrants, or running a lottery.

  • Method Details

    • onCreate

      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Called when the activity is created. Initializes the user interface, sets up event details, and configures buttons for notifications, editing, QR code management, and entrant management.
      Overrides:
      onCreate in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity
      Parameters:
      savedInstanceState - If the activity is re-initialized after being shut down, this Bundle contains the most recent data; otherwise, it is null.

    • setDeleteQRCodeButton

      public void setDeleteQRCodeButton(android.widget.Button oldButton)
      Configures a button to delete the QR code for the event. Deleting the QR code will deactivate it and remove its reference from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      oldButton - The button to be configured for deleting the QR code.

    • regenerateQRCode

      public void regenerateQRCode()
      Regenerates a QR code for the event. Deletes the existing QR code (if any), creates a new one, and updates the QR code details in Firestore.

    • repurposeBackButton

      public void repurposeBackButton(android.widget.Button backButton)
      Repurposes the back button to navigate back to the admin page.
      Parameters:
      backButton - The button to be repurposed.

    • onEventEdited

      public void onEventEdited(String name, String date, String facility, String registrationEndDate, String description, int maxWaitEntrants, int maxSampleEntrants, String posterUri, boolean isGeolocate, String waitlistedMessage, String enrolledMessage, String cancelledMessage, String invitedMessage)
      Updates the event data with edited values from the EditEventDialogFragment.
      Specified by:
      onEventEdited in interface EditEventDialogFragment.EditEventDialogListener
      Parameters:
      name - The updated event name.
      date - The updated event date.
      facility - The updated event location.
      registrationEndDate - The updated registration end date for the event.
      description - The updated event description.
      maxWaitEntrants - The updated maximum number of waitlist entrants.
      maxSampleEntrants - The updated maximum number of sample entrants.
      posterUri - The updated URI of the event poster.
      isGeolocate - Indicates whether geolocation is enabled for the event.
      waitlistedMessage - The updated notification message for waitlisted participants.
      enrolledMessage - The updated notification message for enrolled participants.
      cancelledMessage - The updated notification message for cancelled events.
      invitedMessage - The updated notification message for invited participants.

    • refreshEventUI

      private void refreshEventUI(String name, String date, String facilityId, String registrationEndDate, String description, int maxWaitEntrants, int maxSampleEntrants, String posterUri, boolean isGeolocate)
      Refreshes the UI with updated event details.
      Parameters:
      name - The updated event name.
      date - The updated event date.
      facilityId - The ID of the updated event facility.
      registrationEndDate - The updated registration end date.
      description - The updated event description.
      maxWaitEntrants - The updated maximum number of waitlist entrants.
      maxSampleEntrants - The updated maximum number of sample entrants.
      posterUri - The updated URI of the event poster.
      isGeolocate - Indicates whether geolocation is enabled for the event.

    • updateButtonAppearance

      private void updateButtonAppearance(android.widget.Button button, boolean isActive)
      Updates the appearance of a button based on whether it is active.
      Parameters:
      button - The button to update
      isActive - True if the button should appear active, false otherwise

    • showNotificationInputDialog

      private void showNotificationInputDialog(String title, String existingMessage, EventDetailActivity.NotificationMessageCallback callback)
      Displays a dialog for the user to enter, edit, or delete a notification message.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the dialog.
      existingMessage - The existing message to be displayed in the input field.
      callback - A callback to handle the message after user input.

    • updateNotificationMessage

      private void updateNotificationMessage(String messageField, String message, String notifyField)
      Updates notification messages for a specific event in Firestore. Sets a notification field to true if a message is provided, otherwise sets it to false.
      Parameters:
      messageField - The Firestore field to store the notification message.
      message - The notification message content.
      notifyField - The Firestore field indicating whether to send the notification.
